entry.title: From Days to Minutes: How EPI-USE Labs’ Custom Joule Agent Automates Payroll Variance Analysis with
entry.content:
As a global company, EPI-USE Labs provides software solutions and services to over 1,800 large enterprises worldwide, with a core focus on SAP Human Capital Management (HCM) and Payroll. We have over 40 years of experience in SAP HCM projects and are one of the world's largest independent SAP HR/Payroll specialists. Our solutions, such as Query Manager and Variance Monitor, are key to how our clients manage their SAP Payroll data.

Our expertise extends into AI and developing custom solutions for SAP and SuccessFactors. We are always looking for ways to leverage new technologies (such as Joule) to enhance the efficiency and employee experience for our clients.

Why and What?

Our specific use case was to dramatically reduce the time and effort payroll administrators and employees spend on payroll variance queries. Currently, when an employee's pay changes, the reason for the variance often requires manual investigation, leading to numerous queries, data checking in different systems and delays, that could impact employees. Days can be spent on these investigations and payroll needs to run before a specific date and time.

We are an early adopter of Joule Studio because we recognize that the future of enterprise software is intelligent, driven by agentic AI, and improving user experience. SAP's decision to embed AI and the Joule digital assistant directly into core business operations, aligns perfectly with our strategic focus.

To solve this, we set out to create a custom Joule agent using Joule Studio - AI Payroll Variance Agent.

How?

Joule Studio enabled us to deliver agents that are powered with human-like reasoning, grounded in business data, and connect disparate systems to solve complex, goal-oriented business processes and provide reliable outcomes. Payroll, which is highly complex and rule-based, is an ideal workflow for this type of agentic AI.

We built our custom Joule AI agent was designed to understand and explain complex pay discrepancies in natural language. It's a prime example of utilizing Joule skills and the agent builder capability in Joule Studio to connect disparate data systems and provide immediate, contextual answers.

The Payroll Variance Joule Agent consists of two parts:

  • Custom Joule skill creation: We leveraged our expertise with SAP Payroll data and our Query Manager solution to create Joule skills that can access real-time, live payroll results from SAP ECC On-premises Payroll or SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Payroll. These skills were the "tools" the Joule agent could use for more rule-based, deterministic execution.
  • Custom Joule agent creation: The agent was configured in the agent builder capability of Joule Studio with the goal of "explaining payroll variances". We grounded the agent in the business context by linking it to the payroll data retrieved by our custom skills.

The agent enables payroll administrators to instantly understand the reason for pay changes, such as a decrease in regular working time, a full week absence, or the elimination of overtime, by simply asking a question. This transforms the HR administrator experience by providing the necessary context for follow-up, which ultimately streamlines operations. This capability moves beyond standard deliveries, allowing for custom SAP Payroll automation that dramatically improves transparency and cuts down on investigation time. In a POC with a client of ours, it was estimated that our Payroll Variance Agent saves them three days per Payroll Analyst, per region.

What's next? 

Our early-stage experience working with Joule Studio in SAP Build was overwhelmingly positive. The capability was very intuitive to use, allowing us to quickly develop an agent and skills solution that delivered measurable value and scaled across SAP and non-SAP systems.

We see immense value in SAP Build's environment coupled with Joule Studio's AI capabilities, which empower partners like us to bring sophisticated, business-specific solutions to market rapidly.

Looking forward, we plan on building AI Agents for more complex, multi-step scenarios that require dynamic planning and reasoning across a wider array of SAP and non-SAP systems. Our next steps will focus on integrating Joule with our own Payroll Expert Agent once A2A capabilities are available and build out several use-cases to achieve new levels of efficiency and user experience.

entry.title: The SAP Extended Warehouse Management FAQ Series: Robotic Integration for EWM
entry.content:
With the request to further increase the level of automation in modern and high-performance warehouses integration of robotics to warehouse management solutions becomes increasingly relevant.

This demand is leading to the question on how to best and most efficiently integrate robotics, fleet management systems and multi-agent orchestration platforms to SAP Extended Warehouse Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition.

With this blog post, we would like to discuss some of the most important and relevant questions of the topic of robotic integration to SAP EWM.

What is the right integration technology to integrate robotic systems to SAP EWM?

With SAP EWM there are multiple channels and interfacing options that should be evaluated when integrating robotics and the corresponding fleet management systems.

Typically, robot platforms are integrated via OData APIs, EWM-WCU IDOC interface or via SOAP Webservices and RFCs. Further AGV, AMR and robots can be integrated using MFS over TCP/IP and telegram-based communication. Find further information about available EWM interfaces and specific features and functions via the following links:

  • OData APIs for EWM: Find a list of available ODATA Services for EWM via SAP Help – SAP S/4HANA - APIs for Warehousing or via the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  • EWM WCU IDoc Interface: Find a list of available IDocs for EWM via SAP Help – SAP S/4HANA - Interface Between EWM and Non-SAP Systems.
  • SOAP Webservices for EWM: Find a list of available SOAP for EWM via SAP Help – SAP S/4HANA - Enterprise Services in Extended Warehouse Management.

The choice of the integration technology is majorly influenced by the dedicated robotic vendor (integration to sub-systems), partner solution, requirement against end-to-end visibility, type of robotic integrated/primary function (e.g. mobile robot, manipulation robots, cognitive robots, etc.), size and heterogeny of robotic fleet.

Is there a best-practice architecture for robotic integration?

While the robotics integration is highly depending on the aspects mentioned before in the warehouse context the following types of robots are typically used (listed based on primary function):

  • Mobile Robots: Robots moving through the warehouse such as AMR (Autonomous Mobile Robots), AGV (Automated Guided Vehicles)
  • Manipulation Robots: Robots that physical handle and move items such as picking robots, sorting robots and palletizing/depalletizing robots.

In case there are larger and heterogenous robotic fleets integrated to warehouse solutions there are often Fleet Management Systems (FMS) or Multiagent Orchestration Platforms (MOP) from SAP Partners required to orchestrate and dispatch Workload (Warehouse Orders/Tasks) amongst the integrated fleet, performing position management, analytics, routing and training of robots.

Additionally, there are partner solutions on the market that are specialized on industries and process variants such as eCommerce small parts picking, which can be integrated according to a Black Box-integration pattern (EWM viewpoint), as Warehouse Orders/Tasks are optimized and dispatched via the Fleet Management System (FMS) to an integrated robotic solution (e.g. assisted picking robots).

Considering above mentioned aspects, the following integration patterns are most common and best suiting to the requirements of robotic integration:

                Event-Driven Integration

The event-driven integration considers direct distribution of relevant workload via the Warehouse Order Business Event (available with SAP S/4HANA 2025, FPS0) to the SAP Event Mesh on SAP BTP. From the SAP Event Mesh the Fleet Manager System (FMS) can pick-up the relevant Warehouse Order creation, cancelation, activation or deletion events to initiate retrieving relevant Warehouse Orders.

The integration follows the following steps:

  1. Create warehouse task/- order for movement from source to destination
  • Source and Destination are FMS managed
  • Determine FMS relevant queue for execution
  1. Push Warehouse Order Business Event to SAP Event Mesh
  2. FMS to register for the relevant Warehouse Order Business Event from SAP Event Mesh
  3. Perform Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks retrieval from FMS for relevant Warehouse Orders via the Warehousing API (GET)
  4. Start execution of the Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by updating the operating resource to the Warehouse Order (e.g. FMS or specific robot-unit) by the Warehousing API (POST) (optional)
  5. Confirm Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by FMS by the Warehousing API (POST)

Direct Integration

In basic concept of the direct integration is to either send created Warehouse Orders/Warehouse Tasks to a Fleet Management System (FMS) or retrieve Warehouse Orders/Tasks by the Fleet Management System (FMS).

The integration follows the following steps:

  1. Create warehouse task/- order for movement from source to destination
  • Source and Destination are FMS managed
  • Determine FMS relevant queue for execution
  1. FMS to select open Warehouse Orders/Warehouse Tasks regularly from queue via EWM interface (e.g. ODATA-service, WebService, IDoc).
  2. Start execution of the Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by setting updating the operating resource to the Warehouse Order (e.g. FMS or specific robot-unit)
  3. Confirm Warehouse Order/Warehouse Tasks by FMS

Additionally, there are project-based integrations possible, to integrate robotics via MFS-telegrams or with small robotic fleets to directly integrate robots to EWM.

What is the typical SAP EWM configuration required for robotic integration?

To enable transparency and optimized integration the following customizing is typically configured in SAP EWM:

  • Queues and Queue determination criteria for robots
  • Resource Types for robots
  • Resource Groups for robots
  • Queue sequence for robot’s Resource Group
  • Resource for robot

Implementation of the following interface functions to connect robots with SAP EWM:

  • Push Warehouse Order Events (create, change, delete, activate) to FMS
  • Retrieve Warehouse Orders
  • Assign Robot to Warehouse Order
  • Confirm Warehouse Orders

We are currently evaluating further enhancements to standard functionality on SAP EWM roadmap to improve integration to robotic fleets to enable for a more robust and dynamic integration.

Are there partner solutions available to integutions to SAP EWM most efficiently?

We have partner solutions offering proven integration concepts and contents available via our SAP Store with the following partners:

Partner

Solution

Locus Robotics, Inc.

Locus Autonomous Mobile Robots for SAP EWM

Geekplus Technology Co., Ltd.

Improve efficiency of your warehouse operation by 2 to 3 times

DXC Technology Services LLC

DXC Smart Warehouse EWM Integration with AGVs

Flexus AG

AGV-Hub - Fleet Manager for Mobile Robots

KINEXON Industries GmbH

Connect and automate operations: redefine manufacturing & logistics efficiency

Roboteon Inc.

Roboteon Fulfillment Platform

Beside these there are implementation accelerators and partner solutions available from our partner ecosystem that are not listed yet in the SAP Store.

What is the future of robotic integration with SAP EWM?

With advancing technology both in logistics, business solutions and robotics, new ways of integration are explored and driven forward. SAP’s initiative to combine advanced robotics with enhanced sensorics and AI capabilities – cognitive robots – and AI-infused logistics solutions leads the way towards new opportunities for automation.

BITZER, NEURA Robotics and SAP went live with a proof-of-concept solution to integrate embodied AI agents to EWM for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition. The proof-of-concept validates Joule-based multi-agent orchestration and execution via the humanoid robot 4NE1 for a picking workflow including visual inspection, enabling agentic situation handling according to the business process and priorities. If you would like to learn more about via SAP News - SAP Expands Physical AI Partnerships and Demonstrates Success of New Robotics Pilots. 

If you would like to learn more about robotic integration, please find more information via SAP Community Blog Enhancing warehouse operations by integrating robotics with SAP Extended Warehouse Management or stay tuned for further release updates and posts.

entry.title: Evolution of Data and Analytics with SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
Introduction to Business Data Cloud:

SAP Business Data Cloud was introduced on February 13 2025 as Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution fully managed by SAP. SAP Business Data Cloud is a data & analytics platform that harmonizes all data from SAP and non-SAP sources into a unified semantic layer of trusted data that governs, connects and share data securely across systems or cloud. By integrating powerful functionality of SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP Databricks and SAP Business Warehouse. It empowers businesses to break data silos to power advanced AI and analytics.

Why was Business data cloud introduced?

  • To get easier access to SAP data without the need for complex data preparation steps such as extraction, building semantics, transformation and loading data for analytics.
  • To get access to all SAP data from all Line of Business (LoB) applications, such as SAP S/4HANA, SAP SuccessFactors and SAP Ariba without the need of 3rd party connector & tool.
  • To get a unified business view of the data regardless of which SAP application it originated from without making harmonization difficult and holds its original business context without any change.
  • To accelerate AI with trusted and secure data that they can use to build reliable AI applications to accelerate innovation and insights with AI.
  • To get faster access to SAP data insights by removing data preparation and dashboard building steps.
  • To get a Simplified Landscape by reducing multiple tools, silos and complex tasks of manual data preparation, development and analytics.

Key Features & Capabilities of Business Data Cloud: 

SAP Business Data Cloud Key Innovation of out-of-the-box components

  • Intelligent Applications: Intelligent Applications are predefined, SAP-managed dashboards for analytics based on underlying Data Products and models.
  • Data Products: Create and share governed, reusable data products that deliver consistent, high-quality business information across teams and systems.
  • BDC Cockpit: Centrally manage your data products, monitor usage, and enforce governance policies, all from one intuitive interface.

SAP Business Data Cloud Integrated Software components:

  • SAP Datasphere: to provide the data integration and modelling.
  • SAP Analytics Cloud: to provide the analysis and planning.
  • SAP Databricks: to provide AI and machine learning enhancements.
  • SAP BW/BW4HANA: can be used as a data source for datasphere & databricks.

SAP Business Data Cloud is built on SAP Business Technology Platform:

  • Unified Customer Landscape used to connect the SAP Business Data Cloud components.
  • SAP HANA Cloud provides the data storage layer.
  • SAP Security and Compliance to manage access and permissions and governs regulatory compliance.
  • SAP Development & Integration to provide developer tools for modelling & data Integration
  • SAP AI & Analytics to provide advanced analytics and AI powered insights.

SAP Business Data Cloud Architecture:

  • Source System layer: It harmonizes all data from SAP and non-SAP sources, into a unified semantic layer of trusted data, to power advanced analytics and to build AI applications.
  • Foundation Service Layer: This layer replicates and harmonizes data from the source systems to produce curated, governed Data Products that retain their original business context. Data products are grouped by Data Packages to make it easy to discover them and to activate them. This data is stored in a hyper scaler environment using SAP HANA Cloud and Data Lake files.
  • Business Data Fabric Layer: It combines the strengths of SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), and SAP Business Warehouse (BW) capabilities, enhanced by the Databricks platform to unify an organization with SAP and Non – SAP and third-party data into a single, trusted foundation model.
  • SAP Datasphere is the technological foundation for the business data fabric within BDC. It integrates, transforms, and enriches data from SAP and non-SAP sources into powerful semantic models. Data can be replicated into Datasphere for faster performance or accessed virtually from its source, allowing for flexible management of a hybrid data landscape.
  • SAP Databricks is an Advanced AI and machine learning technology. It provides a pro-code environment for data engineers and AI developers to build, train, and deploy custom AI and ML models using the rich, semantically aware data from SAP applications.
  • SAP Business Warehouse (BW) or BW/4HANA: For customers with existing on-premises SAP Business Warehouse (BW) or BW/4HANA systems, this component provides a modernization path within the Business Data Fabric. A Data Product Generator can be used to convert BW Info Provider data into cloud-ready data products, which can then be consumed by Datasphere for analytics or by Databricks for AI/ML.
  • SAP Business Data Cockpit: SAP Business Data Cloud cockpit allows you to browse and find pre delivered Intelligent Applications and data products, install Intelligent Applications, and share data products with SAP Datasphere & Databricks to enable analytics & enrich with AI and machine learning capabilities.
  • Intelligent Application Layer: It’s a unified semantic layer of trusted data, to power advanced AI & Analytics.
  • SAP Analytical Cloud: Using SAP Analytics Cloud, business users can run ad-hoc analysis, explore the provided data with AI-driven chat capabilities, or act on their insights with AI-driven suggestions, bridging the gap between analytics and their end-to-end business processes.
  • Intelligent Application: SAP Business Data Cloud Intelligent Applications are used to provide the required dashboard in out-of-the-box reporting scenarios with its advanced visualization and planning functions
  • Joule: Joule uses natural language processing to interact, access insights, and perform tasks across SAP and third-party applications. It uses "agents" and "skills" to automate multi-step workflows and provide contextual assistance.

How SAP Business Data Cloud work as one domain model:

Scenario 1: Out-of-the-Box model with Datasphere

Step 1: The first step is to identify the right intelligent application for your business scenario, In SAP Business Data Cloud cockpit search for available intelligent application and install the one that meets your requirement.

Step 2: When intelligent application installation is initiated the relevant business data that has already been bundled into a package in your business application is accessed and replicated to the Foundation Services of SAP Business Data Cloud.

Step 3: Inside the Foundation Services, the replicated business data is harmonized with other data packages from different business applications such as SAP SuccessFactors the data is transformed and enriched to become a data product. The data is now ready to be used as the basis for analysis.

Step 4: In SAP Datasphere all artifacts necessary for the analysis are now automatically generated on top of the Data Product. 

Step 5: Visual representations of the insights are automatically generated and made available in the intelligent application dashboard.

 Scenario 2:  AI and machine learning enhancement by Databricks

Step 1: The first step is to identify the right intelligent application for your business scenario, In SAP Business Data Cloud cockpit search for available intelligent application and install the one that meets your requirement.

Step 2: When intelligent application installation is initiated the relevant business data that has already been bundled into a package in your business application is accessed and replicated to the Foundation Services of SAP Business Data Cloud.

Step 3: Inside the Foundation Services, the replicated business data is harmonized with other data packages from different business applications such as SAP SuccessFactors the data is transformed and enriched to become a data product. The data is now ready to be used as the basis for analysis.

Step 4: In SAP Datasphere all artifacts necessary for the analysis are now automatically generated on top of the Data Product. 

Step 5: Visual representations of the insights are automatically generated and made available in the intelligent application dashboard.

Step 6: Integration of SAP Databricks

It is possible to extend the results shown in the dashboard with machine learning and AI based Insights, to do so use the SAP business data cockpit to share data product with databricks,

In SAP Databricks AI and Machine learning techniques are used to generate the desired result, this results then shared back to the data model and extend your dashboard with AI and Machine learning insights.

Scenario 2:  : Integration of SAP BW & SAP Analytical Cloud

Step 1: The first step is to identify the right intelligent application for your business scenario, In SAP BDC cockpit search for available intelligent application and install the one that meets your requirement.

Step 2: When intelligent application installation is initiated the relevant business data that has already been bundled into a package in your business application is accessed and replicated to the Foundation Services of SAP Business Data Cloud.

Step 3: Inside the Foundation Services, the replicated business data is harmonized with other data packages from different business applications such as SAP SuccessFactors the data is transformed and enriched to become a data product. The data is now ready to be used as the basis for analysis.

Step 4: In SAP Datasphere all artifacts necessary for the analysis are now automatically generated on top of the Data Product. 

Step 5: This is where the integration of your third-party data comes into play. The advanced integration and data modelling capabilities of SAP Datasphere allow you to integrate your third-party data into the out-of-the-box data model.

Step 6: Integration of SAP BW

It is also possible to integrate your existing objects from SAP BW/4HANA into SAP Business Data Cloud. With a dedicated data provisioning tool, you can onboard your SAP BW objects into SAP Datasphere and combine them with the existing data model.

Step 7: Integration of SAP Analytical Cloud 

SAP Business Data Cloud provides a wide range of consumption options on top of your data model. Use the AI-based Just Ask feature in SAP Analytics Cloud. The power of its natural language processing allows you to request information from your data model simply by typing a question about your data. Answers are instantly displayed in the most appropriate format.

Role of Source system & Data product in BDC:

Role of Datasphere in BDC:

 Role of Databricks in BDC:

 Role of BW in BDC:

 Role of SAC in BDC:

 Role of Intelligent Application Dashboard & Joule in BDC:

 
Use Case of Business Data Cloud:

SAP Business Data Cloud can handle many use-cases including:

  • Data Integration & Modelling 
  • Data Governance and Compliance 
  • Development of AI and machine learning models
  • Data Warehousing
  • Planning and BI 
  • Development of intelligent applications to support all business processes.
  • End-to-end data lifecycle management by SAP 

SAP Business Data Cloud reaches all personas of the organization.

Conclusion: 

Data from all SAP applications is combined and made available to the businesses under a single domain model. With SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP has reached the next level of data and analytics evolution to tackle challenges and enables businesses to seamlessly integrate, harmonize, and analyse data from multiple sources, transforming raw data into valuable insights with advanced AI and analytics. 

By adopting the latest 2025 features, organizations can accelerate analytics, improve decision-making, and prepare for AI-driven innovation.

Reference:

Learning Journey: https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/exploring-sap-business-data-cloud
Live Session : https://learning.sap.com/live-sessions/overview-of-sap-business-data-cloud
SAP Help Document : https://help.sap.com/docs/business-data-cloud
GenAI Assistance : Assistance in drafting the structure of blog.

entry.title: How AI is Transforming Your Digital Workspace
entry.content:
How AI is Transforming Your Digital Workspace

Introduction

The modern workplace has changed dramatically. Employees no longer rely solely on static intranets or scattered collaboration tools. Instead, they expect a connected, personalized experience that helps them cut through the noise and focus on meaningful work. Enter artificial intelligence (AI).

AI isn’t just another layer of technology- it’s rapidly becoming the backbone of digital workspaces. By surfacing the right information at the right time, automating repetitive tasks, and enabling smarter collaboration and self-service, AI is redefining how we work, learn, and engage every day.

With digital workspaces in SAP Build, these AI capabilities are already available today—helping organizations deliver intelligent, personalized employee experiences out of the box

The Rise of AI in the Digital Workspace

For years, digital workspaces have been a central hub for business applications, documents, apps, and communications in one place. Useful—but often overwhelming. Employees spent as much time searching for information as they did, acting on it.

Now, AI is filling the gaps. With intelligent copilots, content curation, and contextual answers, digital workspaces like SAP Build Work Zone have evolved from being a destination for information into an engine for productivity and engagement.

Core AI features available today in SAP Build digital workspaces

1. Chatbots & Virtual Assistants
With Joule, SAP’s AI copilot, workspace users can access information instantly. From answering HR questions to surfacing insights from reports, employees can rely on conversational AI to get what they need instantaneously.

Joule, SAP's AI copilot integrated into the digital workspace

2. Task completion with Joule Skills

One can enhance Joule capabilities by creating skills for it in Joule Studio. Connected with SAP systems and third-party applications, Joule can complete tasks like submitting time-off requests, approving workflows, or surfacing KPI dashboards—all from a single interface

  

3. Document Grounding Capabilities
Joule ensures information is both contextual and reliable when using workspace content to ground AI responses. For example, employees can ask “What’s our travel policy in Europe?” and receive an AI response sourced directly from workspace content or SAP SuccessFactors policies when it is enabled as an AI source.

  

4. Content generation and summarization using generative AI
SAP Build leverages generative AI to help users create and refine content—whether drafting announcements, summarizing updates, or suggesting language for a blog post—directly within the workspace.

  

 

 

 

 

Real-Life Examples in Action

  • Information access with grounded responses

Joule responds with answers grounded in the specific workspace content. Employees can query Joule with specific questions like “What is the holiday plan for next year in Germany" or “how can I apply for a sabbatical leave? Point me to the relevant file”.

  • Smart document summaries

Integrated AI services capture the highlights of a workspace document—policy highlights, key insights from data, or high-level overview of a blog.

  • Workflow Automation

From within SAP Build workspace, an employee can ask Joule to “create a purchase order” or “show current pipeline metrics.” The copilot triggers the workflow in connected SAP systems, making productivity seamless.

  • Intelligent content curation

Users can easily create blog posts, feed posts or even knowledge articles in the workspace using the native AI features with simple prompts like “create a workspace feed reminding members to fill their timesheet in a funny and casual tone”.

The Business Impact

  • Faster Information Access: Joule makes information searches 95% faster by surfacing insights and data instantly. Grounded insights reduce time spent searching for answers.
  • Reduced Manual Effort: Generative AI-assisted summarization and content creation free up employee time.
  • Better Governance: AI responses in SAP are backed by enterprise content, ensuring compliance and accuracy.

Preparing for the AI-Powered Workspace

Adopting AI in digital workspaces is not just about flipping a switch—it’s about preparing your organization:

  • Change Management: Train employees to adopt AI workflows and copilots in their daily work.
  • Governance: Define guardrails for AI-generated content, data privacy, and security.
  • Integration: Maximize value by connecting SAP Build with existing SAP and non-SAP applications, making copilots more powerful.

Conclusion

AI is no longer a future trend; it’s already embedded in the digital workspaces employees use today. With embedded AI and Joule, organizations don’t just imagine an intelligent workspace—they experience it

By weaving AI into daily workflows—whether through copilots, recommended learning, or curated content—SAP Build helps organizations unlock productivity, agility, and engagement at scale.

Ready to take the next step?

Learn more about these capabilities and their implementation from the following resources:

  1. Joule integration with Work Zone
  2. SAP Build Work Zone Gets Even More Powerful with AI-Powered Capabilities
  3. Set Up Document Grounding | SAP Help Portal
  4. Integration With Document Grounding | SAP Help Portal
  5. Enabling AI Features | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Joule - Document Grounding with SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition (RAG)
entry.content:
Setting up Document Grounding for SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition

Document grounding (SAP’s implementation of RAG) is a foundational Joule capability which can provide more comprehensive responses by drawing from business documents located in SAP and third-party repositories.

Grounding is a service designed to handle data-related tasks, such as grounding and retrieval, using vector databases. It provides specialized data retrieval through these databases, grounding the retrieval process with your own external and context-relevant data. Grounding combines generative AI capabilities with the ability to use real-time, precise data to improve decision-making and business operations for specific AI-driven business solutions.

Grounding converts user provided documents into vector representations which are stored as a database. The indexing pipeline preprocesses unstructured and semi structured data into chunks and embeddings and the retrieval pipeline takes incoming user queries and converts them into vector representations. The query vectors are used to search the database and retrieval relevant information.

Prerequisites: Before triggering the setup process, make sure that you’ve purchased the AI Unit SKU (8019164) OR AI Units SKU - 8018592. After you’ve done so, the entitlements for document grounding are automatically added to your global account. Validate if you can see the entitlement "Document Grounding" in Global Account -> Service Assignment area.

Document Grounding now supports two authentication mechanisms. Please check the Configure Access from SAP BTP before you start your setup.

This blog focuses on setting up Document Grounding with SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition. If you need to setup Document Grounding for Microsoft Sharepoint, please refer to this blog written by Nagesh: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/joule-getting-started-with-document-grounding-setup-guide/ba-p/13739501

Document types supported for SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition: Blog posts, DOCX, JPEG, JPG, JSON, Knowledge base articles, PDF, PNG, PPTX, TIFF, TXT, Wiki pages (https://help.sap.com/docs/joule/integrating-joule-with-sap/set-up-document-grounding)

 

Setup Steps

Step 1: Enable Document Grounding capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced Edition

Step 2: Enable Document Grounding for Workspaces & Sub-Workspaces in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced Edition

Step 3: Explore Content Locations — Blogs, Wikis, and Documents for Grounding

Step 4: Use an Existing Joule Subaccount or Create a New One to Set Up Document Grounding

Step 5: Create Certificate and RSA Key Files

Step 6: Run cURL commands to setup Document Grounding pipelines

Step 7: Verify and Test Joule

Step 8: Appendix

 

Step 1: Enable Document Grounding capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced Edition

Navigate to SAP Build Work Zone, advanced Edition → App Finder → Administration Console.

In the Administration Console, go to External Integrations → OAuth Clients, and click Add OAuth Client.

Enter a Name and an Integration URL for the OAuth client.

Note: The Integration URL is not validated, so you can enter any placeholder value.

After saving the OAuth Client, click View to display the Client Key and Client Secret.
Copy these values. You will need them later during the integration setup.

OAuth Client Key: dgkey123456

OAuth Client Secret: dgsecretabcdef

Navigate to Administration Console → Feature Enablement → Features
Enable the Document Grounding Integration feature, and then select the OAuth Client you created in the previous step.

From the Administration Console → Overview page, copy the DWS URL.
For example: https://abcdef.eu10-1.dws.workzone.ondemand.com

 

Step 2: Enable Document Grounding for Workspaces & Sub-Workspaces in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced Edition

Workspaces and Sub-Workspaces both need to be enabled for Document Grounding. Selecting only the "Workspace" does not automatically enable Document Grounding in "Sub-Workspaces"

Navigate to SAP Build Work Zone, advanced Edition → Workspaces → New Workspace, and select Public Workspace.

Note: Document Grounding is supported only for Public Workspaces. If you have an existing Private Workspace, you can convert it to a Public Workspace from the Workspace Admin Settings.

In the workspace, navigate to Workspace Admin Settings → Edit Workspace.

Select the checkbox for Document Grounding to enable grounding for the workspace and then click Save

Note: If your setup includes a Sub-Workspace, make sure to enable Document Grounding there as well.
Enabling it at the main Workspace level does not automatically activate it for any Sub-Workspaces.

You can also manage Document Grounding across all workspaces by navigating to SAP Build Work Zone, advanced Edition → Administration Console → Workspaces.

 

Step 3: Explore Content Locations — Blogs, Wikis, and Documents for Grounding

Documents in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition can be uploaded as individual files or referenced from other content areas such as Blogs, Wikis, and Knowledge Base articles.
In these cases, the entire page or article is treated as grounding content. All such sources are indexed and leveraged by Joule to provide accurate, context-aware responses based on your organization’s information.

3.a Content / Files:
In your workspace, go to Content to view existing files or upload new documents that will be used for document grounding.

3.b Knowledge Base:
In your workspace, go to Knowledge Base to create and manage knowledge base articles that can be used for document grounding.

3.c Blog or Wiki:
In the Content area, click Create to add a new Blog or Wiki page. These pages will be indexed and used as grounding content.

 

Step 4: Use an Existing Joule Subaccount or Create a New One to Set Up Document Grounding

Document Grounding must be configured in the same subaccount where Joule (or Unified Joule) is enabled.
Select the subaccount where Joule is already set up and verify that it is hosted in a supported region.

AWS: ap10 – Australia (Sydney), ap11 – Asia Pacific (Singapore), eu10 – Europe (Frankfurt), eu11 – Europe (Frankfurt, EU Access), jp10 – Japan (Tokyo), us10 – US East (VA)
Google Cloud: ap30 – Australia (Sydney), eu30 – Europe (Frankfurt), us30 – US Central (IA)
Microsoft Azure: ap20 – Australia (Sydney), eu20 – Europe (Netherlands), us21 – US East (VA)

For the latest list of supported regions, refer to the official documentation: Supported Regions for Document Grounding

 

4.a Scenarios for Setting Up Document Grounding

Depending on how SAP Build Work Zone is configured in relation to your Joule formation, there are four possible setup paths. As mentioned earlier, the Document Grounding service must always be added to the Joule subaccount.
However, depending on your environment, SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition may be deployed in the same subaccount or in a different one.
The following options outline the supported configurations.

4.a.1 – Unified Joule Already Exists with SAP Build Work Zone, standard Edition

You already have Joule configured, and SAP Build Work Zone, standard Edition is part of the same Joule formation.
In this case:

  • Joule remains integrated with SAP Build Work Zone, standard Edition (the Joule icon will only appear there).
  • You can still use SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition for Document Grounding, but it won’t display the Joule icon because only one system instance can be part of a Joule formation.

Steps

  1. Navigate to your Joule subaccount in BTP Cockpit.
  2. Go to Entitlements → Add.
  3. Search for and add the “Document Grounding” service plan.

 

 4.a.2 – Unified Joule Already Exists with SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition

You already have Joule set up and integrated with SAP Build Work Zone, advanced Edition.
In this scenario, you can directly enable Document Grounding in the same subaccount.

Steps

  1. Navigate to your Joule subaccount.
  2. Go to Entitlements → Add.
  3. Search for and add the “Document Grounding” service plan.

 

Reference (optional): For more details on Setting up Unified Joule for scenarios 4.a.3 and 4.a.4 below you can refer to the SAP Community Blog:
Joule End-to-End Setup Guide for All Lines of Business – Unified Approach

 

4.a.3 – Setting Up Unified Joule for the First Time and Connecting an Existing SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition

You are enabling Unified Joule for the first time and want to use an existing SAP Build Work Zone, advanced Edition that resides in a different subaccount.
In this setup, the Joule subaccount will host Joule and Document Grounding services only—no Work Zone Standard—while your existing Work Zone Advanced Edition will be linked to Joule during the booster configuration.

Steps

  1. Create a new subaccount in your global account to host Joule.
  2. Navigate to Trust Configuration → Establish Trust and set up trust with Cloud Identity Services (CIS / IAS).
  3. Go to Entitlements → Edit → Add Service Plans, and add:
    • Joule
    • Document Grounding
  4. From your Global Account, open Boosters → Set Up Joule, and click Start.
  5. When prompted, select your new Joule subaccount and proceed through the booster steps.
  6. In the booster flow, choose to connect your existing SAP Build Work Zone Advanced Edition tenant to the Joule formation.
  7. Complete the booster to finish the configuration. Once successful, Joule will be active in the Joule subaccount and integrated with your existing Work Zone Advanced Edition tenant.

 

4.a.4 – Setting Up Unified Joule for the First Time (SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition in the Same Joule Subaccount)

You are setting up Unified Joule for the first time and intend to deploy SAP Build Work Zone, advanced Edition directly within the same Joule subaccount (rather than linking an existing external Work Zone tenant).
This configuration keeps all related services — Joule, Document Grounding, and Work Zone Advanced — together in one managed environment.

Steps

  1. Create a new subaccount in your BTP Cockpit to host Joule and Work Zone Advanced.
  2. Navigate to Trust Configuration → Establish Trust, and set up trust with Cloud Identity Services (CIS / IAS).
  3. Go to Entitlements → Edit → Add Service Plans, and add the following:
    • Joule
    • SAP Build Work Zone – Advanced Edition
      (add both advanced and advanced (application) service plans)
    • Document Grounding
  4. From your Global Account, open Boosters → Get Started with SAP Build Work Zone, advanced Edition, and complete the booster to provision the Work Zone Advanced tenant.
    Refer to the official help documentation for detailed guidance:
    Onboarding to SAP Build Work Zone Advanced Edition
  5. After Work Zone Advanced is successfully provisioned, open Boosters → Set Up Joule, and click Start.
  6. Select your newly created subaccount and proceed through the Joule booster steps.
  7. When prompted, choose SAP Build Work Zone, advanced Edition to integrate it with Joule.

 

Optional Steps

If you would like to enable Joule in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition, refer to the following blog for detailed guidance:
🔗 Joule is Now Integrated into SAP Build Work Zone, Advanced Edition

If you would like to enable Joule in SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition, follow the steps described in this blog:
🔗 Activate Joule with SAP Build Work Zone and SAP Mobile Start

 

After completion of Step 4.a.1 or 4.a.2 or 4.a.3 or 4.a.4 proceed to create a Destination

 

4.b Create Destination

In your Joule Subaccount, navigate to Destinations → Create → From Scratch. Enter a Name for the destination. Add the values provided below

Name: HGDGBWZ924 (You can have any name)

Property

Value

URL

The URL is https://<DWS URL>/api/v1/dg-pipeline/metadata

Check DWS URL in the SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition -> Admin Console -> Overview

E.g: https://abcdef.eu10-1.dws.workzone.ondemand.com/api/v1/dg-pipeline/metadata

Type

HTTP

Proxy Type

Internet

Authentication

OAuth2ClientCredentials

Client ID

Enter the value of the OAuth client Key from BWZ Advanced created in Step 1

OAuth Client Key: dgkey123456

Client Secret

Enter the value of the OAuth client Secret from BWZ Advanced created in Step 1

OAuth Client Secret: dgsecretabcdef

Token Service URL Type

Dedicated

Token Service URL

Enter your <DWS URL>/api/v1/auth/token

E.g: https://abcdef.eu10-1.dws.workzone.ondemand.com/api/v1/auth/token

Check DWS URL in the BWZ Advanced -> Admin Console -> Overview

Additional Properties

(Click New Property and manually add these properties to the destination)

HTML5.DynamicDestination

true

SetXForwardedHeaders

false

HTML5.SetXForwardedHeaders

false

4.c Create Document Grounding Service Instance

In your Joule Subaccount, go to Service Marketplace → Document Grounding → Create.

  • Select Runtime Environment: Other

  • Enter an Instance Name: for example, groundingcli

  • Click Create

Create a Service Binding for the Document Grounding Instance

In your Subaccount, navigate to Instances & Subscriptions → Instances
Select your Document Grounding Service Instance, then proceed to "Create Service Binding"

Enter a Binding Name, for example: groundingkey, and click Create

Copy the mTLS Document Grounding Service Binding URL (MTLS URL) for later use.

E.g: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com

4.d Create Cloud Identity Services Instance

In your Subaccount, navigate to Services → Service Marketplace → Cloud Identity Services → Create.

  • Plan: application

  • Runtime Environment: Other

  • Instance Name: groundingCIS

Then click Next (do not click Create yet).

In the Parameters section, enter the following JSON — replacing <doc-grounding-instance-name> with the Document Grounding Service Instance Name you created earlier (E.g: groundingcli) — and then click Create.

{
   "consumed-services":[
      {
         "service-instance-name":"<doc-grounding-instance-name>"
      }
   ]
}

In your Subaccount, navigate to Instances & Subscriptions → Instances
Select your Cloud Identity Services Instance, then proceed to "Create Service Binding"

Enter a Service Binding Name, for example: cisSK, and provide the following parameters. Then click Create

{
    "credential-type": "X509_GENERATED",
    "validity": 365,
    "validity-type": "DAYS"
}

Download the Service Binding file for the Cloud Identity Services instance.

 

Step 5: Create Certificate and RSA Key Files

You’ll now create two files required for secure communication between Document Grounding and Cloud Identity Services (CIS).

Open the CIS Service Binding file and copy the following values:

  • clientid

  • authorization_endpoint

Then, update the authorization_endpoint by replacing /oauth2/authorize with /oauth2/token

E.g: clientid: aaa-bbb-ccc-ddd-eee

E.g: authorization_endpoint: https://abc2wxyz.accounts.ondemand.com/oauth2/token

Copy the certificates (there are 2 certificates) from the CIS Service Binding file (Starting with "----BEGIN CERTIFICATE---- to ----End CERTIFICATE----" and RSA key (Starting with ----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY---- to ----END RSA PRIVATE KEY----) to VSCode (or Notepad++)

In VSCode press Ctrl+H and enter "\n" in Find and "," in Replace. Select "Match Case" and click "Replace all"

After that enter "," in Find and "\n" in Replace. Select "Match Case" and "Use Regular Expression" and click "Replace all"

You will see "2 Certificates" and "1 RSA Key" similar to the screenshot below

  • Save the two certificates into a single file and save it as a .crt file.
    Example: DocumentGrounding.crt

  • Save the RSA private key as a .key file.
    Example: DocumentGrounding.key

 

Step 6: Run cURL commands to setup Document Grounding pipelines

In this step, you’ll use Bruno (or any API client such as Postman) to execute cURL commands that create and configure Document Grounding pipelines in your Joule subaccount.
These pipelines establish the connection between SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition content and the Document Grounding service.

6.a Install Bruno and Create a Collection

Install Bruno: Download and install the Bruno API Client.

Open Bruno and click Create Collection

Provide a Name for the collection, for example: DGcollection, choose a Location to save it, and click Create.

Before proceeding, ensure you have the following two URLs ready:

  • IAS URL (of Joule Subaccount): https://abc2wxyz.accounts.ondemand.com

  • Document Grounding Service Binding URL (mTLS): mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com

In Bruno, perform the following steps:

  1. Select your collection (DGcollection).

  2. Go to Client Certificates.

  3. For the Domain, enter your IAS URL — abc2wxyz.accounts.ondemand.com

  4. Select the Certificate File (DocumentGrounding.crt) and the Key File (DocumentGrounding.key).

  5. Click Add to save the configuration.

Repeat the same process for the Document Grounding Service Binding URL:

  • Domain: mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com

  • Certificate File: DocumentGrounding.crt

  • Key File: DocumentGrounding.key

Click Add to save the configuration.

6.b Create a Bearer Token

In this step, you’ll generate an OAuth 2.0 bearer token to authenticate subsequent API calls for creating Document Grounding pipelines.

  • In Bruno, select your collection (DGcollection).

  • Click New Request and enter:

    • Name: Get Bearer Token

    • URL: Your CIS URL followed by /oauth2/token
      Example: https://abc2wxyz.accounts.ondemand.com/oauth2/token

  • Click Create.

Add Parameters

  • client_id: (from your Cloud Identity Services binding file cisSK.json) Example: aaa-bbb-ccc-ddd-eee

  • grant_type: client_credentials

Add Headers

  • content-type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

  • accept: application/json

Change the method from GET to POST, click Save, then click the → (Send) button.

You will receive a response similar to the example below.
Copy the access_token, as it will be used in the next step to create the Document Grounding Pipeline

{
  "access_token": "xyzxyzxyzxyzxyzxyzxyz",
  "token_type": "Bearer",
  "expires_in": 3600
}

💡Tip: The bearer token is temporary — it expires after the duration shown in expires_in (in seconds).
You’ll need to generate a new access token each time you perform Document Grounding operations in the future (for example, to create, update, or refresh pipelines)

 

6.c Create a Pipeline

In Bruno, click New Request under your DGcollection.

  • Method: POST

  • URL: Your mTLS URL from the Document Grounding Service Binding, followed by /pipeline/api/v1/pipeline
    Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline

  • Click Create.

Add Headers

  • content-type: application/json

  • Authorization: Bearer <your_access_token>
    Example: Bearer eyJqa3UiOiJ…………….odHRwczovL2F6cjJpe

Add Body

  • Change the Body type to JSON and paste the following:

  • The destination is the name of the "Destination" created in your Joule subaccount" (Step 4.c)
{
  "type": "WorkZone",
  "metadata": {
    "destination": "HGDGBWZ924"
  }
}

Click Save, then click → (Send) to execute the request

If the request is successful, the response will display a pipelineId.
This confirms that the Document Grounding Pipeline has been successfully created and linked to your SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition workspace. Copy the pipelineId from the response (E.g:  pipelineId: aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44)

 

Setup Complete

Your Document Grounding setup is now complete.
All configurations between SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition, Joule, and Document Grounding have been successfully established.

Beyond the initial setup, you can perform additional operations using Bruno or cURL, such as:

  • Get all pipelines – retrieve a list of existing Document Grounding pipelines.

  • Delete a pipeline – remove an inactive or obsolete pipeline.

  • Trigger a pipeline – manually refresh or re-index workspace content.

These advanced operations will be detailed in the Appendix section in the end.

 

Step 7: Verify and Test Joule

Now that the setup is complete, it’s time to test Joule. If you already have Unified Joule set up, you can launch Joule directly from the application. (E.g: Successfactors, Ariba, S/4 Private Cloud, IBP etc.)

If this is a new setup, launch Joule by navigating to Subaccounts → Instances & Subscriptions → Joule Instance, click the instance name to open it, and when you see “The service is up and running,” copy the URL and append /joule — for example: https://rigunifiedjoule-test-sge254ddd.eu10.sapdas.cloud.sap/joule

Before launching Joule, create a Role Collection under Subaccount → Security → Role Collections, add the end_user role, assign the role collection to your user in Subaccount → Security → Users.


Ask Joule questions related to your SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition content (files, wikis, blogs, or knowledge base articles) that were included in the grounding configuration. If everything is working correctly, Joule should return context-aware answers derived from your organization’s grounded documents.

 

Step 8: Appendix

After completing the setup, you can manage and maintain your Document Grounding pipelines using additional API operations in Bruno or cURL. These include viewing all existing pipelines, deleting or re-creating a pipeline, manually triggering executions, and checking their status.

 

8.a. Get All Pipelines

Use a GET request to retrieve all existing Document Grounding pipelines in your Joule subaccount. This allows you to verify which pipelines are active and view their associated destinations.

In Bruno: Select your collection (DGcollection) → click New Request → name it Get All Pipelines
Enter the MTLS URL followed by /pipeline/api/v1/pipeline
E.g: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline

Add headers, save, and click → (Send😞 You will see all existing pipelines
accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer <access_token>

Note: You need to get a new Bearer token if the previous token is expired. Check step 6.2 to get a new Bearer token

8.b. Delete a Pipeline

Use a DELETE request with the specific pipelineId to remove a pipeline that’s no longer needed or was incorrectly configured.

In Bruno: Select your collection (DGcollection) → click New Request → name it Delete Pipeline.

Enter your mTLS URL followed by /pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/<pipelineId>
Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44

Add headers, save, and click → (Send):
content-type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer <access_token>
Once executed, the pipeline with the given ID will be deleted successfully

8.c. Trigger a Pipeline

Use a POST request to manually trigger a pipeline execution. This can reindex or update metadata for all grounded documents in the selected pipeline.

In Bruno: Select your collection (DGcollection) → click New Request → name it Trigger Pipeline
Enter your mTLS URL followed by /pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/trigger
Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/trigger

Add Body

{
  "pipelineId": "aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44",
  "metadataOnly": false
}

Add Headers, save, and click → (Send):
accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer <access_token>

Once executed, the pipeline will start executing.

8.d. Check Pipeline Execution/Grounding Status of the documents

To check status of individual documents (files, wiki, knowledge article etc.)

In Bruno: Select your collection (DGcollection) → click New Request → name it Check Grounding Status.
URL: https://<your-mtls-url>/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/<PipelineID>/documents
Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44/documents

Add Headers, save, and click → (Send):
accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer <access_token>

8.e. Check Pipeline Status & Total executions

Replicate steps from 8.d and use "status" and "executions" instead of "documents" in the URL. You will get final status or total number of executions of the pipeline 

URL: https://<your-mtls-url>/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/<PipelineID>/status OR executions

Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44/status
Example: https://mtls.rage.c-1111.kyma.ondemand.com/pipeline/api/v1/pipeline/aa11-bb22-cc33-dd44/executions

entry.title: Want to learn how to design agentic systems with a human-centered approach?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Designing Agentic Systems with a Human-Centered Approach learning journey.

Learning outcome

By the end of this learning journey, you will be able to:

  • Articulate the purpose and structure of the Joule Agent Design Workshop and its role in designing agentic systems that address user and business needs. 
  • Assess whether the Joule Agent Design Workshop is suitable for a specific project context or team. 
  • Prepare the workshop to achieve successful outcomes, including the selection of the right participants and their briefing, set-up of the space and organization of material.   
  • Facilitate each phase of the workshop by guiding teams in analyzing the current state of the activity to automate, identifying agent tasks, describing agent roles, and designing instructions for the agent using provided templates and tools. 
  • Translate workshop outcomes into actionable next steps for agent configuration or follow-up activities. 
  • Adapt the workshop to different formats and situations (on-site, virtual, teaser). 
  •  

Goals

  • Get started with SAP: Building the basics
  • Develop your experience: Skill deepening learning
  • Excel in your expertise: Advanced specialization learning

Please post your question related to the digital learning journey in  the Q&A area.

I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards, Katrin

entry.title: Join SAP Usability Testing Sessions at SAP TechEd Bangalore - Influence your Product Experience
entry.content:
Join our live usability testing session at SAP TechEd Bangalore on November 25-26, 2025.

Usability testing offers a unique opportunity for SAP users to engage directly with the SAP product and development teams. In a focused 60-minute one-on-one session, you’ll interact with product screens and evaluate whether the buttons, terminology, and features meet your expectations and workflow needs.

If you've ever thought, "Why can’t I just click here and make it work?" — this is your chance to influence exactly that. Your feedback helps us create intuitive, user-friendly solutions that better support your business.

Prerequisites for participating in usability testing at SAP TechEd Bangalore

  1. To be able to participate, you need to be an attendee at SAP TechEd Bangalore.
  2. You need to have experience with using the product for which you’d like to participate in a Usability Test.

What you need to know about the registration process

  1. We use the Bookings app to manage registrations for Usability Tests at SAP TechEd. Your data will be stored in our forms on the booking platform. To the extent that the entered information is personal data, the data collected through this form will be used solely for the purpose of organizing and managing the event. In accordance with GDPR requirements, your data will be deleted immediately after the event concludes.
  2. Use the links below to register for the Usability Test Stations at SAP TechEd Bangalore and pick one of the available time slots for the test session.
    Please arrive at the Usability Test Lab (HALL 5) 10 minutes before your scheduled time.
  3. Please sign up with your business email address – it will only be used for scheduling your test session; you will not receive marketing because of this registration.
  4. Email notifications will be sent from Usability Testing Lab Participant Interest Form <UsabilityTestingLabRegistration@sap.onmicrosoft.com>  Please check your SPAM/JUNK folder in case you do not receive the confirmation emails.
  5. Interested in future online user research opportunities after SAP TechEd?
    To receive invitations, please complete the registration form for the SAP User Research Panel.

Usability Test Stations

Usability Test Station 1: 
Integration Flow generation using AI & Groovy scripts, readiness for software upgrade 


Test the AI feature for creating integration flows from scenario descriptions (including Groovy script steps) with error handling. Evaluate Groovy script readiness for the upcoming Integration Cell runtime and explore integration flow creation via Joule using high-fidelity prototypes.

Target audience: Participation in this usability test is restricted to users of SAP Integration Suite who have experience with developing integration flows.

Potential roles include:

  • Integration Developers
  • Solution Architects,
  • SAP BTP Consultants
  • Business Process Experts 

Register here as a tester

 

Usability Test Station 2: 
Test Conditional Task Chains and Port Connections in SAP Datasphere, BDC

We’re inviting experienced SAP Datasphere Modelers and Integrators to participate in a usability testing session for the enhanced Task Chain workflow.

This session focuses on evaluating the new ability to react to task outcomes and define conditional execution paths using dedicated ports:

  • Success (green)
  • Error (red)
  • Any (blue)

These enhancements aim to give users greater control and flexibility in orchestrating complex workflows. Alongside these, participants will also explore other new capabilities introduced to improve error handling and configurability.

A key focus of this session is to assess both usability and the durability of interactions — ensuring that the experience remains stable, intuitive, and efficient across varied use cases.

Your feedback will help us refine and improve our workflows even further.

Target Audience:
Participants need to have experience with cloud implementations and end-user knowledge to participate.

Potential roles include:

  • SAP Datasphere Modeler / Integrator
  • Consultants
  • Developers

Register here as a tester


Usability Test Station 3: 
End-to-End Agentic User Journey for Building Processes with Joule

In this session, participants will experience and evaluate a future-state, agentic user journey for building business processes using Joule, the AI assistant integrated within SAP Build Process Automation. The focus is on exploring how Joule can support users through end-to-end process creation by providing intelligent suggestions, automating repetitive steps, and enabling seamless collaboration with key stakeholders. We aim to understand usability, clarity of guidance, efficiency gains, and how well Joule integrates into existing SAP Build Process Automation workflows. Participant feedback will help refine the interaction model and identify opportunities for enhancing agentic assistance in real scenarios. 

Target Audience:
Participants need to have experience with cloud implementations and end-user knowledge to participate.

Potential roles include:

  • Regular SAP Build Process Automation users
  • Process Designers
  • Citizen Developers
  • Automation Leads
  • Consultants
  • Business Process Experts

Register here as a tester

Usability Test Station 4: 
Smart Helper - An agent you define; actions you approve; Easy Fill: Copy, Paste, and Done in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

This session aims to evaluate the user experience and effectiveness of two AI-powered capabilities: Smart helper- we will evaluate how easy it is to get started, how clear control and approvals feel, and how overall usability and user experience are perceived; Easy Fill - we will evaluate how easy it is to use and if there is something missing. 

Target Audience:
Participants need to have experience with cloud implementations and end-user knowledge to participate.

Potential roles include:

  • Business Process Experts
  • Solution Architects
  • IT Administrators
  • SAP S/4HANA Solution Consultants
  • Developers

Register here as a tester


Usability Test Station 5: 
Evaluate WalkMe Onboarding Experience on SAP SuccessFactors

Evaluate how users access WalkMe tours and engage with the onboarding experience for SuccessFactors features. To evaluate how effectively users can complete key SAP SuccessFactors tasks using WalkMe tours by identifying any usability, clarity, or content issues and gathering feedback to improve the overall experience.

Target Audience:
Participants need to have experience with cloud implementations and end-user knowledge to participate.

Potential roles include:

  • Business Process Experts
  • Solution Architects
  • IT Administrators
  • SAP SuccessFactors Solution Consultants

Register here as a tester

Usability Test Station 6: 
Supercharge your SAP Fiori elements app development with SAP Fiori tools and AI

SAP Fiori tools are evolving to allow companies to dramatically improve developer efficiency by integrating intelligent, AI-enabled features and editors into the development environment. SAP Fiori tools are designed to lower the entry barrier for new teams while providing the advanced capabilities and flexibility that experienced developers demand. In this usability session, you can experiment with some of our early AI-driven features, provide feedback on our tools and our vision, and directly influence our direction for the next generation of intelligent development tools.

Target audience:
Participation in this usability test is restricted to users with experience developing Fiori apps using SAP Fiori tools (which are a part of SAP Build Code). Potential roles include:

  • S/4HANA Developers
  • Web Developers
  • Fiori Developers
  • Fiori Elements Developers
  • SAP Developers
  • Product Owners
  • Users of the Annotation Modeler
  • Other front-end developers leveraging web technologies

Register here as a tester


Disclaimer (for SAP TechEd 2025, Bangalore usability testing interest list)
By registering you are expressing interest to join the participant list for usability testing at SAP TechEd 2025, Bangalore. Registration does not guarantee participation. Selected participants will be notified separately by email once they meet all eligibility criteria required to take part in the sessions and provide feedback. Due to limited seats, we cannot accommodate all registrants; priority will be given to applicants who meet specific selection criteria (for example: product experience, implementation involvement, end-user knowledge, valid licensing status, and other program requirements).

entry.title: How to Handle Posting Issues for Billing Documents Using Joule
entry.content:
Background Information

As a billing clerk, managing billing documents with posting issues can be frustrating sometime. Fortunately, Joule can streamline the process, making it more efficient and less stressful to resolves the posting issues. 

Posting issues often arise when billing documents cannot be posted to the financial account due to errors like closed posting periods. Common errors include accounting errors (F5/286 and F5/903), which occur when the billing date falls outside the open period.

Joule is an AI copilot designed to enhance interaction with SAP business systems. Joule delivers a unified user experience across SAP's solutions, offering conversational interactions to streamline information access, automate business processes, and improve both employee and customer satisfaction. For more information, see What Is Joule.

Prerequisites

  1. Ensure you have the Sales - Billing Documents business catalog (SAP_SD_BC_BIL_DOC_PC) assigned. The Billing Clerk role template (SAP_BR_BILLING_CLERK) includes this catalog by default. 
  2. Set up Joule in your environment. For more information, see Initial Setup. 

Implementation Details

Follow the steps below to try out this feature:

  1. Log in to your Fiori Launchpad as a Billing Clerk. 
  2. Launch Joule. The method for launching Joule differs depending on your platform. See Using Joule | SAP Help Portal.
  3. Ask Joule to find out billing documents with posting issues. You can narrow down your searching results by specifying criteria such as document type, issue type, or sales organization. Note that only the billing documents with accounting access error will be listed here.
  4. Use the Post button or chat commands to post a document. Only one document can be posted at a time.
  5. Review the error message for more details.
  6. As an alternative solution, you can adjust the billing date to a valid date using the quick buttons. When the posting error is resolved, the document will be automatically posted. You can open the billing document to confirm the changes.

By following these steps, you can efficiently manage and resolve posting issues, ensuring a smooth billing process. 

Watch the following video for step-by-step instruction:

entry.title: From Data to Delight—How SAP CX AI Toolkit Transforms Customer Experiences
entry.content:
Introduction
As customer’s needs evolve at lightning speed, it’s more important than ever for businesses to truly tap into their data and unlock new possibilities to stay one step ahead. The SAP CX AI Toolkit is revolutionizing how organizations automate, streamline, and enhance customer interactions. By blending next-generation AI with advanced data analytics, the toolkit accelerates productivity and reveals actionable insights across sales, service, and commerce domains. Additionally, Joule—the integrated AI copilot—offers a seamless interface for accessing all the toolkit’s power.

Why SAP CX AI Toolkit?

SAP CX AI Toolkit bridges operational silos, bringing together CRM, email, and business systems to create efficient, role-specific workflows. With Generative AI features, it streamlines repetitive tasks, delivers proactive business intelligence, and empowers your teams to make smarter decisions—saving you hours and driving tangible results.

Key Benefits

  • Informed Decisions: Combine enterprise and operational data to empower intelligent, data-driven choices.
  • Automated Tasks: Eliminate manual effort by automating routine actions within your team’s existing workspace—whether in a dedicated app or through Joule.
  • Faster Customer Response: Quickly understand customer needs and respond with timely, AI-powered insights derived from comprehensive enterprise data.

Comprehensive Features & Highlights

  1. Role-Specific AI Tools
    The toolkit delivers specialized AI capabilities tailored to vital CX roles:
  • Customer communication automation
  • Summarization of records and meetings
  • Object and image recognition
  • Contextual prompts for sales, service, and marketing
    These tools enable every team to work faster and smarter.
  1. Robust Data Protection
    With best-in-class personal data protection and zero data retention policies, SAP CX AI Toolkit ensures your sensitive enterprise information remains secure and compliant.
  2. Multi-Source Data Integration
    Aggregate and analyze data from diverse systems—Sales, Service, Commerce, CDP, Microsoft 365—and unlock insights across every customer touchpoint.
  3. Configurable Tools
    From data sources to generative templates and prompts, every element is tailored to your organization’s needs, allowing a customized CX automation strategy.

Persona-Based Licensing
SAP CX AI Toolkit’s functionality is organized around three distinct licenses—usable individually or combined, based on your operational persona:

  • SAP Sales Cloud Version 2
  • SAP Service Cloud Version 2
  • SAP Commerce Cloud

Each license unlocks targeted features:

License Type

Key Tools & Features

All Licenses

Intelligent Q&A, Smart Actions, Meetings, Scheduling

Sales Cloud V2

Opportunity Summarization, Prospecting Emails, Discovery Call Questions

Service Cloud V2

Case Overview, Customer Service Responses, Knowledge Base Article Creation

Combined Licenses

Meeting Summaries, Follow-up Emails, Account Overviews

Commerce Cloud

Product Attributes, Descriptions, Image Generation, Visual Search, Blog & Social Posts

 

User Interfaces: Accessing SAP CX AI Toolkit
The toolkit is flexibly accessible through several user interfaces:

  • Web App: Log in using SAP or Microsoft credentials to set up your tenant and access tools as per your license. The web app features an intuitive dashboard, a searchable Q&A bar, customizable AI panels, real-time notifications, and process monitoring.
  • Chrome Extension (Joule): Installable from the Chrome Web Store, Joule places AI functionality at your fingertips across business applications like Outlook Web, SAP Cloud for Customer, and SAP Commerce Cloud. Features are context-aware and can be accessed directly as a browser overlay.
  • Embedded Panel: Integrated into SAP Sales and Service Cloud V2 as a right-side panel, delivering the full web app experience in-context with contact, account, case, and opportunity data.

In-depth Feature Exploration

Intelligent Q&A
Leverages Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) to provide precise, natural-language answers to work-related questions by drawing from your enterprise sources—emails, meeting transcripts, documents, service tickets, product specs, and more. Data privacy is built-in, with no personal data stored in AI models.

Generative AI Tools
Adapted for three core ecosystems, these tools automate:

  • Microsoft 365: Meeting summaries and follow-up emails
  • SAP C4C, Sales & Service Cloud V2: Account/Opportunity summaries, prospecting emails, case overviews, customer service responses, knowledge base articles, discovery call questions
  • SAP Commerce Cloud: Blog/social media post generation, product banner text, ATP inquiries, product review summaries

SAP Commerce Cloud Features

  • AI Product Tagging: Automatically generate and enrich product attributes.
  • Product Description Generation: Create and translate compelling catalog and marketing texts.
  • Product Image Generation: Enhance images, add overlays, and edit visuals.
  • Visual Search: Find catalog products using user-uploaded images—transforming discovery and search.

AI Tools Builder & Agents
Customize the toolkit with AI tools and intelligent agents tailored to your business needs, such as service classification, knowledge base article generation, shopping advice, quote automation, and catalog optimization.

Persona-Based Use Cases

Sales Cloud V2:

  • Combine emails, chats, and sales data for rich insights
  • Generate dynamic content for effective sales outreach
  • Quick, trustworthy answers and efficient interaction summaries
  • Personalized prospecting emails and targeted follow-up actions

Service Cloud V2:

  • Streamline case management and service responses
  • Auto-generate knowledge base content
  • Leverage smart scheduling and notifications for efficient service delivery

Commerce Cloud:

  • Enrich product content and images with AI
  • Automate catalog descriptions and visual searching
  • Drive engagement through AI-powered blog and social posts

Custom AI Tool API Support

The SAP CX AI Toolkit also empowers developers with Custom AI Tool API Support—a set of Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) that enable seamless integration of advanced, tailor-made Artificial Intelligence solutions within external applications. This means organizations can extend AI-driven outcomes to new business scenarios, connecting their unique workflows and data landscapes with the intelligence of SAP CX AI Toolkit agents.

Smarter Customer Engagement with AI Agents

SAP CX AI Toolkit features AI agents—Shopping Agent and Digital Service Agent—each designed to address distinct phases of the customer journey.

Shopping Agent: Your Digital Sales Associate

The Shopping Agent transforms your commerce storefront by engaging customers through natural language conversations. Acting as a knowledgeable digital associate, it understands everything from specific requests—such as “I need a lightweight rain jacket”—to broader needs like “I’m planning a beach vacation.” The agent instantly provides tailored responses, including details about product features, compatibility, and recommendations.

Configuration is flexible, you can integrate the Shopping Agent directly into your online catalog using SAP CX AI Toolkit, and the agent converses in the customer’s language. Purpose-built for both B2B and B2C scenarios (activated via API configuration), the Shopping Agent proactively interacts with customers, refining product suggestions through relevant follow-up questions and guiding them throughout their shopping experience.

Key Capabilities of the Shopping Agent include:

  • Helping customers find and compare products using conversational AI.
  • Understanding and processing complex customer queries through intuitive dialogue.
  • Integrating seamlessly with your e-commerce storefront via a robust, flexible API.

Knowledge Base Integration:
The Shopping Agent can process unstructured data in varied formats as part of its knowledge base. By uploading product manuals, catalogs, or specification documents (PDF, image, text, spreadsheet formats, etc.) to SAP Commerce Cloud, you arm the agent with deep, detailed product knowledge to answer nuanced customer queries.

Digital Service Agent: Intelligent Post-Purchase Support

The Digital Service Agent is designed to deliver top-tier, automated customer support in natural language. Leveraging specific business knowledge sources—configured by your administrator—it answers post-purchase inquiries, resolving common issues and freeing up your service team for escalated cases.

This agent can operate solo or alongside the Shopping Agent, providing unified and continuous support throughout a customer’s lifecycle. For example, after a purchase, a customer with a warranty question interacts with the Digital Service Agent, who pulls relevant information—even translating responses if needed for multilingual scenarios.

Key Capabilities of the Digital Service Agent include:

  • Operating 24/7 to provide answers using precise business knowledge sources (manuals, FAQs, service tickets).
  • Handling service-related requests such as checking order status, processing returns, or addressing product issues.
  • Assisting in both B2B and B2C environments, with API-driven flexibility.

Comparison: Shopping Agent vs. Digital Service Agent

Feature

Shopping Agent (Digital Sales Associate)

Digital Service Agent (Customer Support)

Primary Goal

Drive sales, product discovery, pre-purchase assistance

Resolve service issues, post-purchase customer support

Key Functions

Recommends products; provides features/specs/compatibility info

Answers inquiries (warranties, returns, order status); FAQs

Data Sources

Product catalog & related documents/media

Knowledge base, service tickets, admin-configured sources

Integration

Direct commerce storefront integration

Standalone or in tandem with Shopping Agent

Focus

Product- and sales-oriented

Service- and resolution-oriented

 

In essence, the Shopping Agent is your digital sales expert, while the Digital Service Agent is your first-responder customer service assistant. Integrated together, they deliver a seamless, unified customer experience across all stages of the journey.

Conclusion
SAP CX AI Toolkit is more than a set of AI tools—it’s an innovation engine for your customer experience strategy. With deep integration, robust security, and persona-driven features, businesses can transform the way data is leveraged to create exceptional customer and employee experiences. Whether accessed via the web app, Chrome extension, or embedded panels, SAP CX AI Toolkit is ready to propel enterprises into the future of AI-powered customer interactions.

entry.title: From Legacy to AI-Powered: RISE Transformation Revolution with Joule for developers
entry.content:
Meet John: From ABAP Developer to AI-Powered Transformation Leader

Remember John? He started as a seasoned developer who was initially skeptical about AI assistance in ABAP development. His journey began with simple "quick questions" and real-time coding help through SAP Joule for Developers. Over the past months, we've watched John evolve from struggling with basic syntax queries to confidently generating complete Fiori Cloud applications using the OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard, implementing intelligent business logic with RAP Predict Business Logic, and seamlessly integrating external services through AI-powered OData consumption. What started as curiosity about AI-assisted coding has transformed John into his organization's go-to expert for next-generation ABAP development.

Now, John's mastery of ABAP AI development has reached new heights.
